title.narrative: Peace and Stabilisation Programme Horn of Africa 2018-2022

description.narrative: Denmark's Peace and Stabilisation Programme for the Horn of Africa 2018-2022 covers Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia with a special focus on the ongoing conflict in Somalia, recognizing its regional consequences.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Beneficiaries receive integrated support to socio-economic reintegration as permitted by the security context - Policy frameworks developed
Policy frameworks developed

target.value: Number of policies developed on key areas such as Outreach. screening. reception and reintegration

actual.value: 1 policy reviewed of standard operation procedure finalised

target.value: Number of policies developed on key areas such as Outreach. screening. reception and reintegration

actual.value: Development of HR policy commenced Amnesty Policy approved by Council of Ministers 2019

target.value: Number of policies developed on key areas such as Outreach. screening. reception and reintegration

actual.value: Financial Management Procurement Continued implementatin of existing policies, i.e. HR, MOU Media Policy - Robustness of these policies not clear Emergency SOP in ligt of Covid developed,

target.value: Number of policies developed on key areas such as Outreach. screening. reception and reintegration
Number of policies developed on key areas such as Outreach. screening. reception and reintegration

actual.value:
The project has engaged in building the capacity and providing guidance and advice on the NP, thus supporting the Defector Rehabilitation Programme (DRP) to coordinate the programme’s policies and procedures more effectively. This includes technical support on all the five pillars of the NP - outreach, reception, screening, rehabilitation and reintegration.
Screening Educational & Rehab HR Strategy - working on aligning with NAP for a full strategy Procurement Entry and Exit Procedures & Guidelines Key policy document on the National Programme that is awaiting signature from the FGS. The issue is application and adherence to these policies ans SOP's has not been consistent

title.narrative: Beneficiaries receive integrated support to socio-economic reintegration as permitted by the security context
% Beneficiaries with a guarantor at the point of exit

actual.value: 100 % had guarantors as this is a requirement for exiting the centre.
100 % had guarantors as this is a requirement for exiting the centre.

title.narrative: Participating residents passing end-of-course exams in VET
Participating residents passing end-of-course exams in VET

actual.value: Avg 70 % Q1 69% Q2 - N/A Q3 71% Q4 - N/A Some of the programmatic aspects were suspended as a result of the pandemic and restrictions that limited the amount of interaction and oversight of the rehabilitation programme.

title.narrative: Increased Defection to the FGS
Graduates claiming to earn an income sufficient to cover their basic needs and (where applicable) that of their dependents twelve months after release (%)

target.value: 100% of beneficiaries with a livelihood or a place at an education / training institution by twelve months post-exit

title.narrative: Number of al-Shabaab defectors received in Serendi over the engagement period
Number of al-Shabaab defectors received in Serendi over the engagement period
Increased defection to the FGS
Number of defectors who say they knew of Serendi and amnesty policy before defecting

target.value: 90% of defectors report prior knowledge of Amnesty influenced decision to defect

title.narrative: Defectors do not return to al-Shabaab
Graduates claiming to 'have been accepted' by their family and clan twelve months after release (%)

actual.value: 100 % (Figures of family and community combined) Overall, the figures show once exited from the programme, the acceptance rate by families /clan/communities are generally high. This may be because of the presence of an elder 's involvement that helps with the gaining of acceptance.
75% of the participating residents were accecpted by their families or clans
No data reported in 2018
only data for 1 quarter available standing at 100%.

title.narrative: Graduates claiming to 'have been accepted' by their family and clan twelve months after release (%)
Beneficiaries who have completed at least three months paid work or at least three months in an education / training institution within the first twelve months after exiting Serendi

actual.value: 44% This is a skewed amount because figures for 2 quarters are not available. Therefore this number is based on only half of 2022
54.25% Majority say that the employment does not meet their needs and that of their families. Only 14.25 in said it was sufficient
No data reported

title.narrative: The centre complies with national, regional and international rights standard
The centre complies with national, regional and international rights standard

target.value: Qualitative description of the status of human rights compliance in the center.
Qualitative description of the status of human rights compliance in the center.

actual.value: No Violations reported - Adapted to off sight oversight and mointoring due to limited ability to be on site due to covid restrictions. Ongoing engagement to have other partners and ministries on board as monitors. HR advisor follows up remotely when not on site. - HR training also conducted as part of capacity building and Tool developed

target.value: Qualitative description of the status of human rights compliance in the center.

actual.value:
No Violations reported. Continuous training and integration of IHRL policies and standard is ensured. Providing support to DRP staff to ensuring compliance. Supported and provided remote oversight monitoring,
- Due to the lock down in the middle of Q4 there was limited opportunities for the Human Rights Advisor to follow up on established processes. However, at the beginning of Q4 the advisor visited Mogadishu, but during her visit, the lock down was initiated. She did follow ups by phone and briefed relevant management and team members. - Efforts are currently made to set up an external HR committee to be managed by the UN (UNSOM DDR and UNHR) with the possible back-up of the MoJ to conduct HR monitoring in the future. - Due to the lock down in the middle of Q4 there was limited opportunities for the Human Rights Advisor to follow up on established processes. However, at the beginning of Q4 the advisor visited Mogadishu, but during her visit, the lock dow

target.value: Qualitative description of the status of human rights compliance in the center.

actual.value: No human rights complaints reported by defectors in the Center with zero acts of excessive or unwarranted physical force by guards.

target.value: Qualitative description of the status of human rights compliance in the center.

actual.value: No human rights complaints reported by defectors in the Center with zero acts of excessive or unwarranted physical force by guards.

title.narrative: Comprehensive Communication Strategies implemented
Number of Government Led Outreach Communication Campaigns

target.value: 15 outreach activities led by governement officials

actual.value: 300 leaflets distributed and Toll free call introduced

target.value: Number of defectors that were aware of Government amnesty programmes and/or rehab centres like Serendi

actual.value: 66.5% of new defectors were aware of government amnesty. Most Defectors had heard of some form of Amnesty through mostly word of mouth and radio as well as ad campaigns

target.value: 15 outreach activities led by governement officials

actual.value:
Ad Hoc outreach activities with Albany, DRP and SNA continued, some of those activities interrupted due to covid.
101 new defectors that came to the centre in 2020 heard of amnesty programmes; 55 heard of rehabilitation centres.

target.value: 10 outreach activities led by governement officials

actual.value: No outreach activities conducted
